name: Rosemary Bread
steps: Mix Sugar, Water, and Yeast in a bowl
Let sit for 4 minutes (until bubbly)
Mix in 1 tablespoon each of the Olive Oil and Rosemary
Mix in Salt and Flour
Once consistent, transfer dough to a floured surface
Knead for 10 minutes until dough is smooth and elastic
Lightly coat an opaque bowl with olive oil
Shape the dough into a ball and place in the bowl
Put the bowl in a warm dark corner and cover with a tea towel
Let rise for an hour
Take off tea towel and punch the dough ball down
Divide dough into 2 balls
Spread Olive Oil over each dough ball
Sprinkle remaining tablespoon of Rosemary over the dough balls
Lightly press the Rosemary onto the dough balls with a spoon
Lightly coat a pan with olive oil
Place both dough balls onto the pan with some space between
Cover the pan with the tea towel and place in a warm dark area
Let sit for another 45 minutes
Preheat the oven to 400F
Optional: Place a bowl of boiling water on the bottom oven rack
Remove the tea towel and place the pan on the middle oven rack
Let bake for 12 minutes
Start watching the bread, and take out once top is lightly brown
Let sit for 10 minutes
Cut it into dippable sections, and serve with Oil Dip
